intro: Beloperone cristata, commonly known as the crowned beloperone, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive crown-like arrangement of leaves, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Beloperone cristata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
